verses.verse: In Yahweh,<WH3068> I take refuge.<WH2620> How can you say<WH559> to my soul,<WH5315> "Flee<WH5110> as a bird<WH6833> to your mountain!<WH2022>"

For,<WH7563> behold, the wicked bend<WH1869> their bows.<WH7198> They set<WH3559> their arrows<WH2671> on the strings,<WH3499> that they may shoot<WH3384> in darkness<WH652> at the upright<WH3477> in heart.<WH3820>
If the foundations<WH8356> are destroyed,<WH2040> what can the righteous<WH6662> do?<WH6466>

Yahweh<WH3068> is in his holy<WH6944> temple.<WH1964> Yahweh<WH3068> is on his throne<WH3678> in heaven.<WH8064> His eyes<WH5869> observe.<WH2372> His eyes<WH6079> examine<WH974> the children<WH1121> of men.<WH120>
Yahweh<WH3068> examines<WH974> the righteous,<WH6662> but the wicked<WH7563> and him who loves<WH157> violence<WH2555> his soul<WH5315> hates.<WH8130>
On the wicked<WH7563> he will rain<WH4305> blazing coals;<WH6341> fire,<WH784> sulfur,<WH1614> and scorching<WH2152> wind<WH7307> shall be the portion<WH4521> of their cup.<WH3563>
For Yahweh<WH3068> is righteous.<WH6662> He loves<WH157> righteousness.<WH6666> The upright<WH3477> shall see<WH2372> his face.<WH6440>
